scheme.name: RBA Validated Assessment Program (VAP) Standard
scheme.description: The RBA VAP Standard provides comprehensive guidance for deeper understanding of the Responsible Business Alliance Code of Conduct, offering elements to demonstrate compliance with the RBA Code for companies implementing the RBA Code of Conduct in their operations.

conformityCriterion.name: Labor
conformityCriterion.description: Participants commit to respect the human rights of workers, and to treat them with dignity and respect as understood by the international community. This applies to all workers including temporary, migrant, student, contract, direct employees, and any other type of worker.

subCriterion.name: Prohibition of Forced Labor
subCriterion.description: Forced labor in any form, including but not limited to, bonded (including debt bondage) or indentured labor, involuntary or exploitative prison labor, slavery or trafficking of persons is not permitted.

subCriterion.name: Policy Requirements
subCriterion.description: Have a detailed, comprehensive documented policy prohibiting the use of any type of forced, bonded or indentured labor, involuntary or exploitative prison labor, slavery, or trafficking of persons.

subCriterion.name: No Recruitment Fees
subCriterion.description: No levies, recruiting, hiring or placement fees or costs, even if allowed by local law.

subCriterion.name: No Document Retention
subCriterion.description: No holding original identification documents of workers.

subCriterion.name: Voluntary Overtime
subCriterion.description: Overtime is to be voluntary (i.e., workers can always refuse overtime).

subCriterion.name: Voluntary Resignation
subCriterion.description: Resignation must be voluntary, and the required notice period cannot exceed one month.

subCriterion.name: Procedures and Practices
subCriterion.description: Procedures and practices are in place to ensure no forced labor occurs.

subCriterion.name: Employment Contracts
subCriterion.description: Signed employment contracts or agreements are in place between the worker and the facility, ensuring the worker is provided with documentation of their legal rights and responsibilities.

subCriterion.name: Worker Information
subCriterion.description: Workers are informed before employment of the key employment terms and conditions in writing in their native language or in a language that the worker can understand.

subCriterion.name: Migrant Worker Protections
subCriterion.description: Terms and conditions of employment shall be delivered to migrant workers before departure indicating the conditions of work and remuneration.

subCriterion.name: Young Workers
subCriterion.description: Child labor shall not be used in any stage of manufacturing. Workers under the age of 18 (Young Workers) shall not perform work that is likely to jeopardize their health or safety.

subCriterion.name: Policy Requirements
subCriterion.description: Have a detailed, comprehensive documented young worker policy.

subCriterion.name: Minimum Working Age
subCriterion.description: Child labor prohibition: setting a minimum working age that is no lower than the greater of local law, 15 years of age, or customer expectations.

subCriterion.name: Young Worker Restrictions
subCriterion.description: Young workers are not allowed night work or overtime and are restricted from hazardous positions.

subCriterion.name: Age Verification Process
subCriterion.description: Formal documented process to verify the age of each worker prior to employment.

subCriterion.name: Documentation Verification
subCriterion.description: Inspection and cross-reference to verify the validity of at least two types of official ID and periodically evaluating the documentation for a random sample of workers.

subCriterion.name: Working Hours
subCriterion.description: Working hours shall not exceed the maximum set by local law. A work week shall not be more than 60 hours per week, including overtime, except in emergency or unusual situations.

subCriterion.name: Working Hour Limits
subCriterion.description: Standard hours worked, days off, overtime policy and limits in conformance to local law.

subCriterion.name: Weekly Hour Limit
subCriterion.description: Working hours in the facilities designated standard workweek must not be more than 60 including overtime.

subCriterion.name: Consecutive Working Days
subCriterion.description: Consecutive working days after which a day of rest is granted must not be more than 6.

subCriterion.name: Emergency Situations
subCriterion.description: Emergency or unusual situations that may require overtime in excess of RBA limits.

subCriterion.name: Legitimate Emergencies
subCriterion.description: Equipment breakdown, power failure or other emergency resulting in prolonged shutdown of production line, or unforeseen raw material shortages.

subCriterion.name: Wages and Benefits
subCriterion.description: Compensation paid to workers shall comply with all applicable wage laws, including minimum wages, overtime hours and legally mandated benefits.

subCriterion.name: Wage Policy
subCriterion.description: Detailed, comprehensive documented wage and benefits policy.

subCriterion.name: Pay Equals Time Worked
subCriterion.description: Pay equals time worked applies for any company-required activity (e.g., work, training).

subCriterion.name: Equal Pay for Equal Work
subCriterion.description: Equal pay for equal work and qualification applies to prohibit discrimination.

subCriterion.name: Overtime Premium
subCriterion.description: Overtime compensation at a rate which is the stricter of local law or 125% of the standard rate.

subCriterion.name: Payment Practices
subCriterion.description: System to pay workers for both regular work hours and overtime in accordance with applicable law.

subCriterion.name: Timely Payment
subCriterion.description: Pay (including overtime, others) should be timely per published schedule.

subCriterion.name: Pay Slips
subCriterion.description: Workers are provided with pay slips that clearly list hours worked, wage rates, and deductions.

subCriterion.name: Non-Discrimination / Non-Harassment / Humane Treatment
subCriterion.description: Participants shall commit to a workplace free of harassment and unlawful discrimination. There shall be no harsh or inhumane treatment.

subCriterion.name: Non-Discrimination Policy
subCriterion.description: No discrimination or harassment based on protected characteristics in hiring and employment practices.

subCriterion.name: Protected Characteristics
subCriterion.description: No discrimination based on race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ethnicity or national origin, disability, pregnancy, religion, political affiliation, union membership, covered veteran status, protected genetic information or marital status.

subCriterion.name: Humane Treatment
subCriterion.description: No harsh or inhumane treatment including violence, harassment, or abuse.

subCriterion.name: Prohibited Behaviors
subCriterion.description: No violence, gender-based violence, sexual harassment, sexual abuse, corporal punishment, mental or physical coercion, bullying, public shaming, or verbal abuse.

subCriterion.name: Reasonable Accommodation
subCriterion.description: Reasonable accommodation is provided for religious practices and disability.

subCriterion.name: Religious Accommodation
subCriterion.description: Accommodate group or individual religious practice requests including scheduling changes, dress standards, and facility use.

subCriterion.name: Disability Accommodation
subCriterion.description: Reasonable accommodation for worker's disability including assessments and workplace modifications.

subCriterion.name: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
subCriterion.description: Workers shall be able to openly communicate and share ideas and concerns with management regarding working conditions without fear of discrimination, reprisal, intimidation, or harassment.

subCriterion.name: Right to Organize
subCriterion.description: Respect of the right of workers to form or enroll in a worker representation body, or to refrain from doing so.

subCriterion.name: Open Communication
subCriterion.description: Open feedback channels exist for workers to bring issues to the attention of management for resolution.

subCriterion.name: Regular Communication Sessions
subCriterion.description: Company management conducts regular sessions with workers to discuss their issues or concerns.

category.name: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining

subCriterion.name: Labor Management System
subCriterion.description: Management system designed to ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations and customer requirements related to labor practices.

subCriterion.name: Risk Assessment
subCriterion.description: Adequate and effective labor compliance process to monitor, identify, understand, and ensure compliance.

subCriterion.name: Control Processes
subCriterion.description: Labor responsibilities and authorities are adequately defined and assigned for all employee levels.

subCriterion.name: Communications
subCriterion.description: Adequate and effective ongoing two-way communication process with workers and stakeholders.

subCriterion.name: Performance Review and Continuous Improvement
subCriterion.description: Adequate and effective labor management performance review and continuous improvement process.

conformityCriterion.name: Health and Safety
conformityCriterion.description: Participants recognize that a safe and healthy working environment enhances the quality of products and services, consistency of production and worker retention and morale.

subCriterion.name: Occupational Health and Safety
subCriterion.description: Worker potential for exposure to health and safety hazards shall be identified and assessed, mitigated using the Hierarchy of Controls.

subCriterion.name: Hazard Assessment
subCriterion.description: Risk assessment process to identify the most significant actual and potential occupational health and safety risks.

subCriterion.name: Hierarchy of Controls
subCriterion.description: Risks are addressed through the Hierarchy of Controls: Elimination, Substitution, Engineering controls, Process and Administrative controls, PPE.

subCriterion.name: Gender-Responsive Measures
subCriterion.description: Gender-responsive measures for pregnant women and nursing mothers to ensure they are not in working conditions hazardous to them or their child.

subCriterion.name: Pregnancy Risk Assessment
subCriterion.description: Worker-specific risk assessment of the worker's job to assess risk to the mother and fetus when pregnancy is reported.

subCriterion.name: Nursing Accommodation
subCriterion.description: Provide reasonable break time and location for a worker to express and store breast milk for nursing child.

subCriterion.name: Emergency Preparedness
subCriterion.description: Potential emergency situations shall be identified and assessed, and their impact minimized by implementing emergency plans and response procedures.

subCriterion.name: Fire Safety Equipment
subCriterion.description: Adequate and effective fire detection, alarm and suppression systems are in place.

subCriterion.name: Fire Detection
subCriterion.description: Automatic heat and/or smoke detection as required by law or insurance company.

subCriterion.name: Fire Suppression
subCriterion.description: Portable fire extinguishers and automatic fire sprinklers as required by law or insurance company.

subCriterion.name: Emergency Exits
subCriterion.description: Adequate number of exits and maintains exit aisles and passageways free of obstructions.

subCriterion.name: Clear Egress Routes
subCriterion.description: Clear and unobstructed egress including adequate number of effective exit routes from every area.

subCriterion.name: Exit Door Requirements
subCriterion.description: Exit route doors open without using a key, badge, code, special knowledge, or effort, and available at all times.

subCriterion.name: Emergency Drills
subCriterion.description: Emergency evacuation drills are conducted regularly for all work areas and shifts.

subCriterion.name: Fire Evacuation Drills
subCriterion.description: All workers and shifts must participate in evacuation drills, including at least one drill conducted while it is dark outside.

subCriterion.name: Food, Sanitation and Housing
subCriterion.description: Workers shall be provided with ready access to clean toilet facilities, potable water and sanitary food preparation, storage, and eating facilities. Worker dormitories shall be maintained to be clean and safe.

subCriterion.name: Worker Housing
subCriterion.description: Dormitories, bathrooms, and employee spaces will be clean, safe, and well-maintained and meet international housing standards.

subCriterion.name: Living Conditions
subCriterion.description: Facilities are well-maintained, including adequate lighting, heating, and ventilation. Sufficient living space exists for the number of workers assigned.

subCriterion.name: Emergency Egress
subCriterion.description: Clear, well-lit stairwells and multiple exit routes adequate for the number of workers served, with exit doors unlocked from the inside.

subCriterion.name: Food Safety
subCriterion.description: Safe food handling processes and hygiene standards in refrigeration, storage, and preparation areas.

subCriterion.name: Food Handling
subCriterion.description: Food service workers wear masks, hair nets and gloves as necessary to prevent food contamination. Food is stored properly and used before expiration.

subCriterion.name: Drinking Water
subCriterion.description: Water must be tested for contaminants assessed to be at risk for the local region and operations.

subCriterion.name: Water Quality
subCriterion.description: Water meets World Health Organization (WHO) Guidelines for Drinking-water Quality or equivalent standard.

conformityCriterion.name: Environment
conformityCriterion.description: Participants recognize that environmental responsibility is integral to producing world-class products. Participants shall identify environmental impacts and minimize adverse effects on the community, environment, and natural resources.

subCriterion.name: Environmental Permits and Reporting
subCriterion.description: All required environmental permits, approvals, and registrations shall be obtained, maintained, and kept current.

subCriterion.name: Permit Management
subCriterion.description: Facility maintains a registry/inventory of environmental permits, licenses and certifications including monitoring and reporting requirements, expiration dates.

subCriterion.name: Energy Consumption and Greenhouse Gas Emissions
subCriterion.description: Participants shall establish and report against an absolute corporate-wide greenhouse gas reduction goal. Energy consumption and all Scopes 1, 2, and significant categories of Scope 3 greenhouse gas emissions shall be tracked, documented, and publicly reported.

subCriterion.name: GHG Tracking and Reporting
subCriterion.description: Energy consumption and all Scopes 1, 2, and significant categories of Scope 3 GHG emissions are tracked, documented, and publicly reported at least annually.

subCriterion.name: Scope 1 and 2 Emissions
subCriterion.description: Scope 1 and 2 Greenhouse Gas emissions are documented, consumption recorded and accurate by source with description of boundary.

subCriterion.name: Scope 3 Emissions
subCriterion.description: Significant Scope 3 GHG categories are determined through materiality process and tracked, including Category 1 (purchased goods and services).

subCriterion.name: Public Reporting
subCriterion.description: Publicly report corporate-wide GHG footprint as quantitative value of total emissions representing annual emissions.

subCriterion.name: Absolute Reduction Goal
subCriterion.description: Absolute reduction goal must include scopes and categories covered, boundaries, base year and target year, target value and target type.

category.name: Energy Consumption and Greenhouse Gas Emissions

conformityCriterion.name: Ethics
conformityCriterion.description: To meet social responsibilities and to achieve success in the marketplace, Participants and their agents shall uphold the highest standards of ethics.

subCriterion.name: Business Integrity and No Improper Advantage
subCriterion.description: The highest standards of integrity shall be upheld in all business interactions. Participants shall have a zero-tolerance policy to prohibit any and all forms of bribery, corruption, extortion, and embezzlement.

subCriterion.name: Zero Tolerance Policy
subCriterion.description: Formal set of standards of business conduct signed by senior management with zero tolerance for bribery, corruption, conflict of interest, anti-competitive behavior, embezzlement.

subCriterion.name: Gift Policy
subCriterion.description: Written gift giving policy ensures gifts to or from suppliers and/or customers are not excessive in value or frequency.

subCriterion.name: Conflict of Interest
subCriterion.description: Encouragement of workers/employees and suppliers to declare potential and actual conflicts of interest.

category.name: Business Integrity and No Improper Advantage

subCriterion.name: Privacy
subCriterion.description: Participants shall commit to protecting the reasonable privacy expectations of personal information of everyone they do business with, including suppliers, customers, consumers, and employees.

subCriterion.name: Personal Information Protection
subCriterion.description: Preventing unauthorized disclosure of personal information and compliance with privacy and information security laws.

subCriterion.name: Data Collection Consent
subCriterion.description: Information is only collected, stored, processed, transmitted, or shared after the individual has given their approval or as defaulted by local law.

conformityCriterion.name: Supply Chain Management
conformityCriterion.description: Participants shall establish human rights, health and safety, environmental and ethics policy statements affirming Participant's commitment to due diligence and continual improvement.

subCriterion.name: Company Commitment
subCriterion.description: Participants shall establish human rights, health and safety, environmental and ethics policy statements affirming Participant's commitment to due diligence and continual improvement, endorsed by executive management.

subCriterion.name: Code of Conduct
subCriterion.description: Code of Conduct covering all elements of the RBA Code (Human Rights, Health and Safety, Environment, Ethics and Management Systems) is established and endorsed by executive management.

subCriterion.name: Executive Endorsement
subCriterion.description: The Code of Conduct is signed by company executive management and senior management actively supports implementation.

subCriterion.name: Public Communication
subCriterion.description: The Code of Conduct is made public and communicated to workers via accessible channels in a language the workers understand.

subCriterion.name: Due Diligence Elements
subCriterion.description: Code contains elements of due diligence, access to remedies for stakeholders where the participant caused or contributed to adverse impacts, and continuous improvement.

subCriterion.name: Materials Restrictions
subCriterion.description: Participants shall adhere to all applicable laws, regulations, and customer requirements regarding the prohibition or restriction of specific substances in products and manufacturing, including labeling for recycling and disposal.

subCriterion.name: Materials Restriction Program
subCriterion.description: Adequate and effective program for materials restrictions as formal part of procurement and manufacturing processes.

subCriterion.name: Chemical Composition Documentation
subCriterion.description: Documented process to measure and/or document the chemical composition of products including review process for comparing customer requirements to specifications.

subCriterion.name: Supplier Requirements
subCriterion.description: Documented requirements for conformance with Material Restrictions communicated to material/parts suppliers with analytical data required.

subCriterion.name: Responsible Sourcing of Minerals
subCriterion.description: Participants shall adopt a policy and exercise due diligence on the source and chain of custody of tantalum, tin, tungsten, gold, and cobalt in products to reasonably assure they are sourced consistent with OECD Guidance.

subCriterion.name: Conflict Minerals Policy
subCriterion.description: Policy to reasonably assure the tin, tungsten, tantalum, gold and cobalt (3TG+C) in products are sourced consistent with OECD Due Diligence Guidance.

subCriterion.name: OECD Due Diligence
subCriterion.description: Commit to exercise due diligence on source and chain of custody of minerals in accordance with OECD Due Diligence Guidance covering all 3TG+C.

subCriterion.name: Public Communication
subCriterion.description: Policy communicated to suppliers and public via company website, Corporate Responsibility Report, or supplier Code of Conduct.

subCriterion.name: Due Diligence Implementation
subCriterion.description: Procedures and practices to perform due diligence in accordance with OECD Due Diligence Guidance.

subCriterion.name: Supply Chain Understanding
subCriterion.description: Understand which parts/materials contain 3TG+C and the chain of custody to determine if they are from Conflict-Affected and High-Risk Areas.

subCriterion.name: Risk Mitigation
subCriterion.description: Mitigate risks identified per OECD Guidance, including suspending or terminating business relationships when risk mitigation fails.

subCriterion.name: Supplier Responsibility
subCriterion.description: Participants shall establish a process to communicate Code requirements to suppliers and to monitor supplier compliance with the Code.

subCriterion.name: Supplier Communication
subCriterion.description: RBA Code of Conduct requirements have been communicated to all next-tier suppliers as an expectation.

subCriterion.name: Contract Requirements
subCriterion.description: Contracts in place for all next-tier suppliers with terms requiring conformance to RBA Code and enforcement language on implementation.

subCriterion.name: Major Supplier Identification
subCriterion.description: Major next-tier suppliers have been identified including labor agents/contractors and on-site service providers.

subCriterion.name: Supplier Monitoring
subCriterion.description: Adequate and effective process to ensure Major next-tier suppliers implement the RBA Code.

subCriterion.name: Risk Assessment Validation
subCriterion.description: If self-reported risk assessment (SAQ) is used, information needs to be validated and high-risk facilities validated via audit (RBA VAP, CMA, AMA).

subCriterion.name: Corrective Action Process
subCriterion.description: Work with suppliers to develop CAP including containment, root cause analysis, corrective actions, responsible persons, due dates, and closure verification.

subCriterion.name: Labor Agent Oversight
subCriterion.description: Special focus on labor agents and on-site suppliers for forced labor, working hours, wages & benefits, and housing provisions.

subCriterion.name: Worker Interview Verification
subCriterion.description: More than 5% of workers through labor agents/contractors cannot accurately describe employment terms meeting RBA labor requirements results in severe finding.

performanceLevelCode.name: Priority Non-conformance
performanceLevelCode.description: A priority non-conformance is any finding leading to: Imminent Risk to life, limb, facility, the environment, or the community; Egregious ethical breach

performanceLevelCode.name: Major Non-conformance
performanceLevelCode.description: Violation of applicable law; Systemic failure (e.g., same incident multiple times or multiple incidents at the same time); Non-conformance situation in which equal or greater than 20% of total sample population is affected.

performanceLevelCode.name: Minor Non-conformance
performanceLevelCode.description: One-off incident, not likely to repeat; A non-conformance situation in which less than 20% of the total sample population is affected.

performanceLevelCode.name: Risk of Non-conformance
performanceLevelCode.description: If the condition or practice meets minimal conformance with the requirement but would likely deteriorate to a non-conformance without some additional action or effort on the part of facility management.

performanceLevelCode.name: Opportunity for Improvement
performanceLevelCode.description: A situation which is not fully in conformance or can be improved but where a Corrective action plan is not mandatory but recommended.

performanceLevelCode.name: Conformance
performanceLevelCode.description: Conformance is noted when the assessor determines that a facility meets or exceeds the assessment criteria and expectations.
